          <img class="image" id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolderCol2_oArticleTextDetail_ArticleImg" src="http://media.salemwebnetwork.com/YWJ/CMS/ImageGallery/Reviews/Books/2015/Freshmen_30DayDevo_lg.250w.tn.jpg"/>
         </div>
         <div class="body" id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolderCol2_oArticleTextDetail_BodyDiv">
          <p>
           Lars Rood
          </p>
          <p>
           <a href="http://www.Group.com" target="_blank">
            Simply Youth Ministry
           </a>
           , 2013, 70 pp., $6.99
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          Lars Rood, a youth pastor of more than 20 years, has been writing and releasing a series of short 30-day devotionals for every grade for middle and high school students.
          <em>
           <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Freshman-Priority-Devotional-Freshmen-Students/dp/0764490028/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1423602949&amp;sr=8-1&amp;keywords=Freshman%3A+Making+Faith+a+Priority-+a+30+day+devotional" target="_blank">
            Freshman: Make Faith Your Priority
           </a>
          </em>
          is one that was written not long ago, but is a cornerstone for the series. The transition from middle school to high school is such a huge time in the lives of our young people in so many ways. This book gives them help for the next big steps spiritually during this time of change.
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          The 30 devotionals included in this helpful little book are quick and to the point for the busy freshman. Each devotional begins with an honest and personal challenge, followed by a challenge to think and act. Each devotional ends with a selected Scripture that applies to the topic.
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          The book is broken down into three sections of 10 devotionals addressing the big first of entering high school; growing in faith; and discovering where Jesus is in 10 areas of a young person's life. Through the systematic, though laidback, setup of this book, readers truly are prepared to be freshmen who can make faith a priority.
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          You easily can hand this off with confidence to your outgoing eighth graders or the incoming ninth graders of your ministry. This is a great book to consider giving out as a middle school graduation present or a high school welcome gift for youth in your church.

           @import url(/ywjadmin_wysiwyg.css);
          </style>
